1.text: And Bildad the Shuhite will answer and say,

2.text: How long will ye set an end to words? Ye shall understand, and afterwards we will speak.

3.text: Wherefore were we reckoned as cattle, and were unclean in your eyes?

4.text: He rent his soul in his anger: shall the earth be forsaken for thee? and shall the rock be removed from its place?

5.text: Also the light of the unjust shall be extinguished, and the flame of his fire shall not shine;

6.text: The light was darkened in his tent, and his lamp shall be extinguished for him.

7.text: The steps of his strength shall be straightened, and his counsel shall cast him down.

8.text: For he was cast into a net by his feet, and he will go about upon latticework.

9.text: A snare shall lay hold upon the heel, the noose shall hold fast upon him.

10.text: His gin being hid in the earth, and his snare upon the beaten path.

11.text: Terrors made him afraid round about, and scattered him to his feet.

12.text: His strength shall be hunger, and destruction being prepared at his side.

13.text: It shall devour the bars of his skin: the first-born of death shall devour his bars.

14.text: His confidence shall be plucked out from his tent, and it shall drive him to the king of terrors.

15.text: It shall dwell in his tent, from not to him: brimstone shall be scattered upon his dwelling.

16.text: From underneath, his roots shall be dried up, and from above, his harvest shall be cut off.

17.text: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, and not a name to him upon a face without.

18.text: They shall drive him out of light into darkness, and they shall exclude him from the habitable globe.

19.text: No offspring to him, and no progeny among his people, and not a survivor in his dwellings.

20.text: Others were astonished at his day, and the ancient took hold on shuddering.

21.text: Also these the dwellings of evil, and this the place of him not knowing God.
